title.narrative: 4.2 MONITOR OF THE SITUATION OF CHILDREN

description.narrative: Government institutions implement comprehensive and specialized mechanisms to monitor the situation of children and adolescents, and evaluate impact of public policy, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents who face multiple deprivations have increased access to pertinent, effective and integrated social protection system taht are properly funded, monitored and evaluated

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

related-activity.ref: 1380/A0/05/604 SOCIAL INCLUSION & MONIT OF CHILDS RIGHT

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government institutions implement comprehensive and specialized mechanisms to monitor the situation of children and adolescents, and evaluate impact of public policy

description.narrative: The CO contributed to strengthening national statistics systems to monitor the situation of children and adolescents critical in tracking the progress of the SDGs. The CO is supporting the development of the National Health Survey and fostering National Multidimensional Poverty Index Measures (adopted by El Salvador in 2015) to inform the elaboration of a costed, evidence-based strategy for poverty eradication. According to UNICEF´s research, there is a need to target households with children and adolescents who are identified as the most vulnerable using the multidimensional poverty data. Targeted strategies must be developed and tailored for urban, peri-urban and rural households. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: A Children Participation and Well Being Agenda have been developed and is used for policy formulation at all levels
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of advocacy and engagement to place child poverty as a national priority

baseline.value: Government has not conceptualised a child-specific multidimensional poverty measure

target.value: 2020:Existence of a proposal for systematically monitoring of a child-specific multidimensional poverty
